Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Enterprise Products agreed to pay a $75,215 civil penalty and provide at least $4,310,000 funds to Supplementary Environmental Projects in settlement of allegations that flares at the Chaparral Gas Plant exceeded its permitted emission limits.

Enterprise Field Services agreed to pay a $36,203 civil penalty and perform a Supplemental Environmental Project of installing a Vapor Recovery Unit at a compressor station at a cost of $1,763,664, in settlement of allegations the facility exceeded its permitted air emissions limits multiple times and had inaccurate or missing records.

Enterprise Products agreed to pay a $186,180 civil penalty and perform a Supplemental Environmental Project with an estimated cost of $931,761, in settlement of allegations several facilities exceeded their permitted air emissions limits multiple times and failed to submit excess emission reports.

Agency: New York Department of Environmental Conservation

Notes: Settlement included a $9,344 Supplemental Environmental Project.
